de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.uiproperties

Class MultiStateUIProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.uiproperties.UIProperty
      • de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.uiproperties.MultiStateUIProperty

  • public class MultiStateUIProperty
extends UIProperty
    A UIProperty with multiple allowed states, whose values are unknown at compilation time. Upon instantiation the number of states is set, while the user can change the values of each state in the configuration wizard.
    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

    • Method Detail

      • setStateValues

        public boolean setStateValues(java.lang.String[] vals)
        Sets values for the states of the UI property. If the array of values is too long, then the supernumerary values are ignored. If the array is too short, then the corresponding states are modified while the other ones are left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        vals - Array of values.
        Returns:
        True if some values were set, false otherwise.

      • setStateNames

        public boolean setStateNames(java.lang.String[] stateNames)
        Gives names to the states. If stateNames has less entries than the number of states, then only the corresponding states will be updated. If it has more entries, then the supernumerary entries will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        stateNames - State names
        Returns:
        True if some names were set, false otherwise.

      • getNumberOfStates

        public int getNumberOfStates()
        Returns the number of states.
        Returns:
        Number of states.

      • getStateIndex

        public int getStateIndex(java.lang.String val)
        Returns the index of the state corresponding to the value val. If the value is not amongst the states, returns 0.
        Parameters:
        val - The state value.
        Returns:
        The index corresponding to the value.

      • getStateValue

        public java.lang.String getStateValue(int pos)
        Returns the value of the state in position pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - Position of the state.
        Returns:
        Value of the state.

      • getStateValues

        public java.lang.String[] getStateValues()
        Returns the array of values.
        Returns:
        State array.

      • getStateName

        public java.lang.String getStateName(int pos)
        Returns the name of the state in position pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - Position of the state.
        Returns:
        Name of the state.

      • getStateNameFromValue

        public java.lang.String getStateNameFromValue(java.lang.String value)
        Returns the name of the state corresponding to value. The first state will be returned if the value does not correspond to any state.
        Parameters:
        value - Value
        Returns:
        Name of the state, or the first state if value does not correspond to any state.

      • setPropertyValue

        public boolean setPropertyValue(java.lang.String val)
        Sets the value of the MMProperty to val if val equals either one of the state values or one of the state names.
        Overrides:
        setPropertyValue in class UIProperty
        Parameters:
        val - New value
        Returns:
        True if the value was set, false otherwise.

      • getConfigurationStateLabel

        public static java.lang.String getConfigurationStateLabel(int i)
        Returns the generic name for state i.
        Parameters:
        i - State number
        Returns:
        Generic name

      • getGenericStateName

        public static java.lang.String getGenericStateName()
        Returns the generic state name for String search and comparison: ".*"+STATE+"\\d+".
        Returns:
        generic state name
